TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DynamicResourceExtensionConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Converts from parsed XAML to and supports dynamic resource references made from XAML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Referencing the type converter is not typically necessary for typical scenarios that involve making resource references either from XAML or code. For more information about the markup extension that this type converter supports, see [DynamicResource Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## XAML Text Usage

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type destinationType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: Context in which the provided type should be evaluated.
The type of the destination/output of conversion.
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object that specifies the culture to represent the number.
Value to be converted. This is expected to be type .
Type that should be converted to.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to another type.
Docs.returns: The returned converted object. Cast this to the requested type. Ordinarily this should be cast to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `destinationType` is expected to be type <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>; if not, then the implementation falls through to base (<xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertTo%2A>, which may throw an exception).
